page.title: 17WHITE DEER- HOUGHTON ESTATE
page.content: The herd of white deer living in the 397 acres of Houghton park are a popular attraction to visitors of the Hall.The 4OO strong herd are white fallow deer, similar in stature to ordinary fallow deer but pure white.The majestic stags in the Autumn and the does and fawns in Spring make a magnificent sight across the park.During Spring, Summer and Autumn the herd graze the parkland, but in Winter they are fed regularly with carrots, beet, hay and pelleted fodder.Also in Winter the keepers build semi-circular shelters of straw bales to protect the fawns and does from the cold Norfolk winds.To maintain a constant size,and purity of colour the herd is culled twice a year -approximately 1OO deer are killed by police marksmen with rifles.The carcasses are now a lucrative comodity
